long:
Meaning: "vigor", literally (force, in a good or a bad sense) or figuratively (capacity, means, produce); also (from its hardiness) a "large lizard".
Usage: ability, able, chameleon, force, fruits, might, power(-ful), strength, substance, wealth.
Source: or (Daniel 11:6) "כּוֹחַ"; from an unused root meaning to be firm;
